ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The course broadened most people's knowledge on both theology and ecology, which was very helpful. Writing the final paper, I was able to really investigate what I wanted to learn, but also use key aspects of the entire course along the way.

I thought discussion in class was lively and facilitated very well by the professor. I appreciated that at certain junctures, we were given the opportunity to choose whether to continue studying a particular topic the next week or move on to another.
The discussions following the readings were fascinating.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Sometimes, the reading load was a little hefty. Thus, I don't think everyone did all of it, and the discussions were less valuable.
None that I can think of.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am an undergraduate majoring in Environmental Studies, with a concentration in Environmental Ethics, so this course fits in very well with my program of study.
It served to help dive into issues of ethics in my reasons for working on the environment.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course because I am specifically interested in the interaction between religion, culture, and the environment. There are not many courses offered at Yale that study this, so I take every chance I can get.

I am very interested in the intersection of religion and ecology and in examining how religious communities can contribute to an environmental ethic. I have had little to no experience with Christianity, so I thought this would be a good opportunity to learn.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: It met my expectations in that I further got to investigate the interaction between religion and ecology. Not having a large enough theology background though caused me to not understand a good amount of the analytical material.
Absolutely. I feel like I have a much better understanding of how Christian theology relates to the environment, both in positive and negative ways.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Do all of the reading, and be prepared to argue with the professor. He loves this.
